checklist.title: Is the wellness guide content accurately structured and properly formatted?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code properly structures the wellness guide with clear section headings, proper hierarchical organization, and consistent formatting. Check if HTML semantic elements (header, section, article) are used appropriately, and if styling provides clear visual hierarchy between main sections, subsections, and content items. Score 0 if structure is chaotic, 5 if basic structure exists but lacks semantic HTML, 10 if fully organized with proper HTML5 semantic elements.

checklist.title: Are interactive wellness tracking elements implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the implementation includes interactive elements like checkboxes for daily wellness tasks, activity timers for the Arbor Day activities, or progress trackers for water consumption. Evaluate whether these elements store user progress (localStorage) and provide visual feedback when completed. Deduct 5 points if no interactive elements exist, 3 points if they exist but don't save user progress. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there a time-sensitive content display mechanism?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements date-aware content that recognizes the current date (relative to March 12, 2025) and adjusts recommendations accordingly. Check if there's a countdown to the special Arbor Day activity time window (3:00-5:00 PM) and notifications/reminders for optimal activities based on time of day. Deduct 5 points if no date awareness exists, 3 points if only basic date checking is implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there personalization functionality for wellness recommendations?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code allows users to input personal health information (allergies, health conditions, age) and adjusts recommendations accordingly. Check for preference settings that remember dietary restrictions, wellness goals, or climate adaptations. Deduct 5 points if no personalization exists, 3 points if only basic preference settings without recommendation adjustment. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser compatibility issues, offline usage, timezone differences affecting recommendations, incorrect user inputs) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Animation showing optimal sunbathing position 2. Interactive meridian point map for acupressure guidance 3. Seasonal ingredient availability visualization). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple date checking mechanisms) 2. Function modules unrelated to wellness guidance (e.g., a built-in game) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow loading). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data/view/controller layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows traditional Chinese medicine aesthetics and modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (natural greens/browns with seasonal accent colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ‚â• 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ‚â§ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance for wellness activities timing. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key wellness tracking functions. The full score is 10 points.
